source.ac9985b2:
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as px
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
source.1af4f97b:
#list to store count of people in range 18-28, 28-38,38-48,48-58,58-65
#maximum age is 64 in our data
count= [0,0,0,0,0]

for Age in medical.age:
    if Age in range(18,28): count[0]+=1
    elif Age in range(28,38): count[1]+=1
    elif Age in range(38,48): count[2]+=1
    elif Age in range(48,58): count[3]+=1
    else: count[4]+=1
print(count)
source.f4a7ce3e:
#creating dataframe of Age range and their respective count
age_count= pd.DataFrame({'Age':['18-28', '28-38','38-48','48-58','58-65'],
                        'Count':count})
age_count
source.d2f9c05d:
plt.title('No. of customers in different age group')
sns.barplot(x='Age',y='Count',data=age_count)
source.e523fef5:
sns.distplot(x=medical['age'])
plt.xlabel('Age')
plt.title('Density of customers of different Age group')
source.da5f2846:
# plotting a pie chart to represent the share of week foot players

labels = medical['region'].unique() 
size = medical['region'].value_counts()
colors = plt.cm.Wistia(np.linspace(0, 1, 4))
explode = [0, 0, 0, 0.1]

plt.figure(figsize=(10,7))
plt.pie(size, labels = labels, colors = colors, explode = explode, shadow = True, startangle = 90)
plt.title('Region wise distribution of Customers', fontsize = 25)
plt.legend()
plt.show()
source.6fd6718e:
count = medical['region'].value_counts()
sns.barplot(x=medical.region.unique(), y=count)
plt.xlabel('Region')
plt.title('Region wise smokers')
source.0fc3e6b5: Above barplot shows most of the customers are in Age range 18-28.
source.c7df0674: From above two plots conclusion comes out that insurance customers are mostly non-smokers among males as well as females.
source.f4d67a47: Above pie chart shows that Region wise distribution of Customers is almost same.
source.c9d7064c: Above histogram plot is more informative as compared to previous bar plot. Because it shows no. of customers in age group 23-64 are almost similar. Age group 18-22 has more customers.
source.e2ae5db7: Plot shows that bmi is highest for males.
source.34c7ac8d: We can conclude that insurance company must target people in Age group 18-28 because they are more interested in getting insured.
source.5e34b6ad: Above description shows that there are no outliers in dataset. It is because age is considerable which is in range 18-64 and similar reason for other attributes.
source.7634bac1: Above kernel density estimate(kde) plot shows most of medical insurance customers have bmi in range 25-35.
source.f2c42f2a: We want to find range of Age with maximum customers. On solving this we will get to know our target customers.
source.f183cc2b: Almost similar result as Regionwise distribution of Customers.
source.d4ccd813: There are more female smokers with bmi in range 20-25 as compared to male smokers in that range.
